body_html:
Can you share the exact sequence of sess.run() calls? I can't quite tell from the snippets in the question, but if for example you do:

print sess.run(label[i])
print sess.run(weight[i])
print sess.run(score[i])

...each sess.run() call will return values from a different batch. If instead you do:

print sess.run([label[i], weight[i], score[i]])

...it will print a label, weight, and score from the same batch.
body_text:
Can you share the exact sequence of sess.run() calls? I can't quite tell from the snippets in the question, but if for example you do:
print sess.run(label[i])
print sess.run(weight[i])
print sess.run(score[i])
...each sess.run() call will return values from a different batch. If instead you do:
print sess.run([label[i], weight[i], score[i]])
...it will print a label, weight, and score from the same batch.
body:
Can you share the exact sequence of `sess.run()` calls? I can't quite tell from the snippets in the question, but if for example you do:

```python
print sess.run(label[i])
print sess.run(weight[i])
print sess.run(score[i])
```

...each `sess.run()` call will return values from a different batch. If instead you do:

```python
print sess.run([label[i], weight[i], score[i]])
```

...it will print a label, weight, and score from the same batch.
